Next.js.description: A React framework for production that enables server-side rendering and static site generation for building fast web applications.

React.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, known for its component-based architecture and declarative approach.

TailwindCSS.description: A utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces without leaving your HTML.

Qwik.description: A resumable JavaScript framework that focuses on delivering instant-on web applications with near-zero JavaScript overhead.

Node.js.description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, used for building scalable server-side applications.

TypeScript.description: A strongly typed superset of JavaScript that adds optional static types, enhancing code reliability and scalability.

Fastify.description: A highly performant and low-overhead web framework for Node.js, designed to handle high traffic and scale efficiently.

NestJS.description: A progressive Node.js framework for building efficient, scalable, and enterprise-grade server-side applications with TypeScript.

PostgreSQL.description: A powerful, open-source object-relational database system known for its reliability, data integrity, and robustness.

Firebase.description: A comprehensive mobile and web application development platform by Google that offers a suite of tools and services.

AWS.description: Amazon Web Services, a secure cloud services platform offering a wide range of computing, storage, and networking solutions.

Cloudflare.description: A global cloud network that provides a suite of services to secure, accelerate, and optimize websites and applications.

GCP.description: Google Cloud Platform, a suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure Google uses for its end-user products.

Git.description: A free and open-source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects.

GitHub.description: A web-based platform that provides hosting for software development and version control using Git.

GitLab CI/CD.description: A part of GitLab that provides an integrated continuous integration and continuous deployment service for automated software development.

Kubernets.description: An open-source container orchestration system for automating the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

Docker.description: A platform that uses OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers, isolating them from the environment.

Python.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language widely used for web development, data science, and artificial intelligence.

PyTorch.description: An open-source machine learning framework based on the Torch library, used for building deep learning models.

Scikit-learn.description: A free software machine learning library for Python that features various classification, regression, and clustering algorithms.

Pandas.description: A software library for Python used for data manipulation and analysis. It provides data structures and operations for manipulating numerical tables and time series.

Numpy.description: A fundamental package for scientific computing in Python, providing support for multi-dimensional arrays and matrices.

LangChain.description: A framework designed to simplify the creation of applications using large language models (LLMs).

LangGraph.description: A library for building stateful, multi-actor applications with LLMs, inspired by LangChain's Expression Language.
